intro: Myrrhis ternata, commonly known as the lesser mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-yellow flowers. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. The plant has a fibrous root system and produces a distinctive, aromatic resin. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of its native ecosystems.
